meanings.definition: Stollens (noun): a type of German fruit bread typically containing dried fruit and nuts
meanings.sent1: During the holidays, my grandmother bakes delicious stollens for us to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: I bought a stollen from the bakery to have with my morning coffee.
meanings.sent3: The stollens at the Christmas market looked so tempting that I bought one for each family member.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of freshly baked stollens filled the kitchen, making everyone's mouth water.
meanings.sent5: The stollens were so soft and flavorful that they melted in my mouth with each bite.

meanings.definition: Stollens (verb): past tense of the verb 'stollen', meaning to steal or take something without permission.
meanings.sent1: He stollens a cookie from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent2: The thief stollens valuable items from the museum late at night.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the mischievous character always stollens snacks from his friends.
meanings.sent4: The raccoon cleverly stollens shiny objects to decorate its nest.
meanings.sent5: The pirate captain was known to stollens treasures from unsuspecting ships on the high seas.
